attributes.action: Suspend Astley Warehouses & Launch Independent Review of Wigan Council Planning.
attributes.additional_details:
Wigan Council forced through 18m warehouses towering over homes and a school - no Environmental Impact Assessment, no Landscape Review, no public consultation, and maps that erased local houses. 

Families are breathing dust & living in shadows. We have been subjected to pollution, noise, & health problems - & the warehouses will be open 24/7.

This is a systemic failure that demands independent investigation & accountability. Government must intervene and review how this was allowed to happen.
attributes.background: The Government should commission an independent investigation into Wigan Council planning department's handling of the Astley Business Park warehouse development, examining its planning processes, competence, ethics, and oversight, and suspend further work until the review is complete.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions which call for actions with regard to named individuals, organisations or businesses.

We also have to reject petitions that call for action at a local level.

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this.

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP
